1.content:
You walk along the sidewalk of your neighborhood, wrapped in your jacket on this slightly chilly day. Yet, the cool air frees your mind and it refreshes your throat. With a small bag of groceries in your hand, you are glad to have walked to the nearby market rather than drive as you thought about how you'd go about your life now that you had graduated from your high school.

Arriving home, you hear the fireplace crackling in the living room. After putting up your jacket, you call out to your father.

"I'm back!"

There's silence but knowing that your father must be home since the fireplace wasn't on before, you step in and see him on the couch, solemnly gazing in his hands a picture frame with his wife.

You sigh, not saying anything for a little bit as you head towards the kitchen open to the living room. After a few minutes of getting things organized, you finally address him as he remain motionless.

"Dad, don't you think it's time to move on?"

"You're right, son, but..."

He chuckles sadly before shaking his head. "...I think it's better for you not to worry. Your mother has gifted me the best son I could have asked for and I've done my part to take care of you. I think now you should just leave this old man to live your own life."

You frown, rather irritated by his lonely outlook.

'Maybe I will. This is getting ridiculous,' you think.

As harsh as it is, your father has everyday took time to remember his life with his wife and your mother, Angelica. While he had plenty of memories, you had none as she died when you were a baby.

Disconnected, you couldn't understand why, like other men and women who lost their spouse yet still remarried, he still hadn't. It makes you concern about leaving to go off to college and leaving him alone.

"...so you're just going to keep looking at that picture of mom and remembering every day?" you question.

"You wouldn't understand, son. She was better than any women out there at the time. This is the best I can do for her. I'm sorry that you didn't have time to get to know her."

You let out an exasperated breath and started to cook up a meal. No longer talking to him, you thought about yourself and whether you'd be also this sad if you got to know her.

Maybe it's a good thing you didn't.

Regardless, if you could, you would be open to the idea of experiencing what it would be like to have a mother. Maybe then, you'd understand why your father continues to be bummed out.

Cutting into an onion, you focus in silence before you hear deep, uncomfortable silence. While it was just you and your father wallowing, it wasn't truly silent with the fireplace active and the sound of wind blowing outside.

All of that stopped making the air rather eerie. Looking up at your father, you notice that he's even more unmoving than before and isn't even blinking!

"D-dad?"

"Oh, isn't this sweet?"

A velvety, sultry voice causes you to flinch and turning into a nearby corridor where the voice came from, you open your mouth to see a tall voluptuous lady with red hair, cut neatly to her shoulders, purple irises that seemed to glow along her petite face. Her complexion was beautiful to the point you had no doubt she had to be a model.

Yet the most striking feature is not only her protruding assets barely confined by her black dress that flowed downward, but a pair of horns growing out from the sides of her head.

"H-how did you c-come in here?!"

Trying your best not to become distracted by her beauty. You immediately rush to your phone but before you could grab it, an invisible force prevents you from moving.

"Come now, is this the first time you've seen a demon?"

Demon?

You grunt as your arms pin to your sides without your control and you feel your body lifted in the air. At this moment, you scream in fear as it becomes apparent that the invader of your home is not any normal person.

Struggling over this woman's levitating hold, she motions with a finger, pulling you closer towards her.

"Let me see you more clearly."

With only a foot of space apart, you are forced to stare into the demoness' eyes as she lifts a hand to graze your cheeks.

"Baren Neil, is it?" she questions, smiling amused.

"Wh-who...are y-you?" you ask, feeling both strangely aroused suddenly after she touched you. This only makes you more frightful.

"As I've said before Baren, I'm the demon, Lily...and I've heard your wish."

"W-wish?"

Lily giggles and you are pulled closer, suddenly nuzzled up against her body with your head smooshed between her chest.

Beyond your control, you pop a boner in your pants feel it pressing up against her legs as you attach to her like a magnet.

"Why yes," she purrs and holds you, rubbing her hands across your back, "...you want a mommy, don't you?"

"N-no, I..."

"Don't deny it," she cuts you off, still rubbing your back soothingly, "...while you are annoyed with your father, you do have regrets not knowing what it would be like to have a mother. Your poor father loved your mother dearly while you...have nothing."

"A-ah..."

You feel her taking control of your hips, forcing you to grind against her as she continues to speak.

"Let me give you a lifetime opportunity, Baren. I will give you the power to pick someone to be your mother and a little extra. I think that would be fun, don't you think?"

"S-stop, please..."

You feel a pressure rising below as her body jiggles in such a blissful manner against you. At any moment, while you try your hardest, you knew you'd explode soon down there.

"It doesn't have to be normal either," she continues, licking her lips, "...since you don't know what having a mother is like, that relationship can take on any form. Twisted, romantic, maternal, oh so many directions!"

"Guhaa!"

You ejaculate, much to the please of this devil who watches you melt away in humiliation, fear, and pleasure. She holds you tighter and presses her face closer to you.

"Kiss me Baren and I'll breathe in your chance to move forward in life...and also backwards. Deal with me! There are no catches, not for you!"

You couldn't answer as your eyes rolled up. Memories of when you were a baby, cuddling with your mother flowed through your brain. It was locked memories that shouldn't be possible to be aware of, yet here the devil had opened them for you just so you could have a starting point.

"M-mom...?"

Tears flows from your eyes and Lily smirks, leaning down to kiss your cheek.

"It's beautiful isn't it? What you might not know and neither does your father...is that your mother is my dear sister, another devil!"

You shake for a few seconds before the pupils return to your eyes. It was hard to believe it, but your heart felt it was true. There was so many questions going through your mind in this second but what you want...what you desire...

Lily had revealed it perfectly to your shame and horror.

So with your mind clear yet strained, you kiss Lily and she readily accepts the invitation to your lips. You felt something changing inside of you before the world blacks out.

When you woke...
1.title: A demon's offer

12.content:
You gasp, your eyes nearly popping open and your body heaving upwards. Many things flows through your head and it causes you to roll back to the ground, writhing in pain.

'Hello, Baren...you might be wondering if this is a dream...'

"Urgh!"

'...but it's not. You also might not want to accept the reality that you, yourself is part-demon but it's true. Feel it in your heart and understand that this is why your father could not get remarried because...there would be nobody better than her.'

"S-stop it!" you scream, grabbing your head.

'...I've implanted this message so that you're not terribly lost but it's time you start finding your own way. Your father will manage alone. As for you, it would be wise to start looking for a new family, a place to live, a place to love. Just find anyone, there's plenty of beautiful women and mothers in New York. If you will them to be your mother, they will treat you exactly as their son and being the demon you are, you can take advantage of that...and more.'

You grunt, the pain starting to lessen and trying to get yourself back on to your feet, you curse everything on to Lily who had turned your life upside down so suddenly.

'For now, goodbye my sweet nephew. We'll be seeing each other again'

With the last message in your head gone, you felt the pain subside completely and in its place, anger...humiliation...fear.

"Fuck!"

Cursing out loud, you breathe heavily and watch a column of light spill from where you are standing. Between two buildings and hearing the bustling noises of cars honking and foot traffic, you couldn't help but feel certain that Lily's words rang true: Somehow or another, you were transported to New York, far from home.

Away from your lonely father.

When you wished to leave, you didn't intend it to be like this.

First, what should you do? As it is now, ,you probably look like a wreck but with no money, no connections in New York, could you really believe what Lily says?

You place a hand to your face and groan.

'A...mother, huh?'

Lily had unlocked what little memories of your mother you had which was to say, not much. What is important though is the feeling of being nurtured and loved within the short span of time before she passed away.

This gives you a taste of what you now realized you were missing, yet...how could you indulge in someone else being your mother? What was the point of that?

Maybe you are missing something, but whatever powers Lily bestowed to you might be your chance to survive in this city.

The hug shocked Baren as he laid staring over the woman's shoulder. After trying to gather his mind and try to make sense of the sudden change in the pretty blonde's behavior, he pulled back a little.

"Um...I'm sorry, Who are you and what's going on?" Baren asked, confused on how the woman suddenly knew his name and not to mention, started to act incredibly amiable to him.

Equally, the blond woman furrowed her eyebrows with confusion over Baren's question. "W-who am I? Baren, I'm your mother! How can you not recognize my face? Come on, let's stop joking around and get out of this alleyway, okay?"

The woman stood up and offered a hand over to the confused Baren. Unsure what to do, Baren accepted the help and pulled himself off the ground thanks to the lady. He lowered his head and then widened his eyes as the woman's words started to process within his mind.

She thought she was his own mother! That demon actually wasn't lying!

Baren looked up to the blond woman who stared at him with concern. Pulling her lips together and giving a warm smile despite her own concern, she reached her hand over and cupped Baren's cheek.

Baren blushed, still feeling a little uncomfortable by this whole situation but this was what he wished for. Eventually, he figured he'd get used to it. It was...nice...to see some form of caring by a woman. He wasn't talking by any woman as his ex-girlfriend certainly cared about him, but that was in a different context from a mother's love.

"Come on sweetie, I'll take you to my work...or would you prefer to stay at our apartment next to us until I come back?" she offered.

Baren blinked. "Their" apartment was just next to their position? This couldn't be a coincidence, it appeared that demon had purposely placed him here. Honestly, he wasn't sure how to feel about that.
